revised_title: X-ray Crystallography Studies of Eukaryotic Transcription Initiation Factors
tldr: The article discusses X-ray crystallography studies of eukaryotic transcription initiation factors, focusing on TATA box-binding protein (TBP) and its role in transcription initiation. The structure of TBP, TBP bound to a consensus TATA element, and the ternary complex of transcription factor IIB (TFIIB) recognizing TBP bound to a TATA element are analyzed. TBP is found to induce a dramatic conformational change in the DNA, and its structure resembles a molecular "saddle" that sits astride the DNA.
